abstract: BHP Billiton extended the offer period for its $39 billion takeover of Canada’s Potash Corp on Monday, after failing to win immediate backing from Canadian authorities.

lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton extended the offer period for its $39 billion takeover of Canada’s Potash on Monday, after failing to win immediate backing from Canadian authorities, Reuters reports.

headline.main: In Extending Potash Bid, BHP Shows It Will Wait

abstract: BHP Billiton is prepared to walk away from its $38.6 billion bid for Potash if a rival suitor makes an offer so high that a deal does not make sense for BHP’s shareholders.
snippet: BHP Billiton is prepared to walk away from its $38.6 billion bid for Potash if a rival suitor makes an offer so high that a deal does not make sense for BHP’s shareholders.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of BHP Billiton said Tuesday that the British-Australian mining company was prepared to walk away from its $38.6 billion bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan if a rival suitor were to make an offer so high that a deal did not make sense for BHP’s shareholders, Reuters reports.

headline.main: BHP to Walk Away if Potash Bids Go Too High
